poem:
Title: "In the Kitchen of Dissonance"

Smoky tendrils twirl away,
False flags of hope burn astray,
Cookstove lies of carbon sway.
Care's illusion, overstated day by day.

Beneath the global greenhouse glare,
Kerosene whispers fill the air,
Lamenting stories of despair.
A thousandfold mischance we bear.

Yet, in every human fume,
May blossom forth a greener bloom,
Daily death to finally un-doom.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Every year, an estimated 3.2 million people a year die prematurely from household air pollution caused by cooking with smoky fuels such as wood, paraffin or kerosene, which produce about 2% of global greenhouse". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
